首先，我不喜欢角色的培养模式，我知道10级转职可以获得最大收益，巫师极限魔攻和刺客极限物攻，也知道实际上xjb玩每个职业都试一试到最后属性也差不了多少，但我不能接受一个最有用的属性是需要我一个职业一直玩才能获得最大成长的，我个人会更好接受加点类型的角色培养，而不是由系统算法决定。
然后，这个游戏设计最不合理的一点来了，数值设计崩坏。什么意思？这个游戏攻击和防御的数值是有“破防”的概念的，也就是说，实际上攻击数值达不到最低破防标准那就是输出很低，反之就有很可观的输出。而实际游戏体验是怎样？我正常推图，甚至把支线全做了，还是打主线怪像刮痧，这种感觉很不好，非常影响我的游戏体验。到最后给我一种什么感觉？我打怪，不是刮痧，就是秒杀，很无聊。

这个游戏的最终目标或者说后期内容是什么？我的结论是“角色培养”，而不是刷黑咒岛的多周目，这是达成“角色培养”的手段以及检验方式，但不应该是目标，毕竟黑咒岛的内容也不够多，说实话可以算贫瘠，只是一块难度远高于主线内容的dlc岛屿罢了。那么这个“角色培养”应该怎么实现？装备，黑咒岛箱子给了，等级，黑咒岛怪给了，那内容呢？刷黑咒岛就完了，就刷那么几块图的怪，开boss箱子就完了。那我玩什么呢？就吃灰了不是吗？

但我还是推荐各位都试试，首先不贵，可以算非常便宜又有相当制作的游戏，虽然地图小但是一个周目的支线也够玩上几十小时了，再来游戏设计很有特点，试试不亏。也只有试过了才知道这个游戏到底对自己是个怎样的存在，我也是知道很多人期待龙信2但最后又大失所望所以才玩的龙信1，但结果是，嗯，我不是目标用户。

186002076.review:
[h1]Dragons Dogma Review[/h1]

[h3]Schwache Story
Kantige Open World
Miese NPCs

Kann das Spiel überhaupt etwas? Ja es kann! Dank Dark Arisen![/h3]

[u]Spiele Setup:[/u]
vor 8 Jahren auf der PS3 :-) bis zum ersten Reisesplitter, Ladezeiten Katastrophe^^
Steam Deck OLED handheld Mode 40fps 8tdp (max Settings) <-- Favorit
Steam Deck Docked FHD Beamer 60fps (Max Settings) Dual Sense
PC 170 fps WQHD (Max Settings) Dual Sense

[h3]Gameplay 09/10[/h3]

Die Kämpfe sind fordernd, anstrengend, man muss arbeiten, bei Fehler wird man nicht verschont, Ausrüstung bzw. Waffenaufwertungen machen unheimlich viel Spass.
Alles in allem ist der Kampf das Highlight vom Game! Diese Dynamik, diese Variationen und vorallerdem, das erste RPG, welches ich keinen Magier bevorzuge! 
Die ki der NPC Begleiter lässt manchmal zu wünschen übrig, dennoch lernen sie mit und daraus resultierend können sie zu starken Helfenr sich avancieren! 
Näheres über die Pawns kann man im Youtube nachforschen.
Die Insel Finstergram ist das Highlight vom Spiel. Dort die Monster zu jagen(am Anfang war es eher umgekehrt) machte riesen Spass, die Nerven lagen blank bei knappen Fights, jedoch durch das  kontinuierliche verbessern der Skills (meiner Input skills^^) konnte ich zum Beispiel den Bishop mit lvl 56 bezwingen!
Es erinnerte mich stark an die Souls Spiele und ich hatte das gleiche Gefühl beim spielen wie bei DeS, DS1 und 2! (Wohlgemerkt nur die Insel Finstergram!)
Der finale Bossgegner in Finstergram ist und war für mich eine Spielgeschichtsoffenbarung! Dank des hohen Schwierigkeitsgrads konnte ich die Atmosphäre  
kombiniert mit dem Soundtrack öfters genießen, was mir sogar ganz lieb war!

[h3]Atmosphäre 08/10[/h3]

Das Hauptspiel ist von der Atmosphäre her wie eine fade 08/15 Fantasywelt, nichts besonderes, Grafik ist in Ordnung. 
Wir reden hier von einem PS3 Spiel welches schon mehr als 15 Jahre auf den Buckel hat. Doch das Addon Dark Arisen und die darin enthaltene Insel Finstergram ist so gut konzipiert und durchdacht, dass ich die Atmosphäre auf die 9 hieven muss.
Das Spiel läuft flüssig wobei FPS Drops in höherer Auflösung geschehen sind.

[h3]Story 09/10[/h3]

Das Hauptspiel 08/10, Finstergram 10/10.
Ich will hier nicht spoilern die Hauptstory empfaltet sich schwach, im Finale jedoch geht sie steil bergauf.
Wenn Dragons Dogma ohne dem Addon wäre würde das Spiel schnellstens in Vergessenheit geraten. Aber die Insel Finstergram erzählt so eine epische Story mit einem leidtragenden Bösewicht das mir die Worte fehlten. Die NPCs wirken alle schlecht geschrieben, das Schauspiel beim Herzog ist so ziemlich B-Movie Trash (auch die bezirzende Herzogin!)
Überhaupt wirkt die aufgesetzte Welt so kantig, dass diese wiederum das ganze glaubwürdig macht!

[h3]Sound 08/10[/h3]

Wenige Soundtracks, der Opener wird nach einer Zeit lame, Finstergram und der letzte Bossfighrt wiederum waren ein Earorgasm.
Nichtsdestotrotz ist das zu wenig. 
Die Dialoge sind dafür richtig gut gesprochen. Hier haben wir ein tolles britisches Englisch welches gut in Szene gesetzt ist.
Schade das die japanischen Stimmen die bei der PS3 dabei waren nicht in der Steam Version inkludiert sind. 

[h3]Content 10/10[/h3]

Finstergram... Mehr sage ich nicht dazu, der  Gameplayloop dort hat mich solange im Bann gezogen, immer ein besseren Dolch immer ein besseren Bogen, dann Drachen geprägt und und und... 
Der Speicherstand sagt 130 Stunden davon sind 80 Stunden nur in den einen Mega Dungeon gemacht worden!

[h3]Zusammenfassung 09/10[/h3]

Das Hauptspiel würde bei mir eine schwache 8/10 bekommen, da kann auch das ausgezeichnete Gameplay nicht viel retten.
Finstergram jedoch ist und war eine Offenbarung. Selten hat mich ein Spiel durch sein Addon so überzeugen können, so färbte das Addon auch auf das Hauptspiel ab,
den der Lore wird in Finstergram um einige Anekdoten dazu erzählt was der es schon tollen am Ende erzählten Story des Hauptspiels eine zusätzliche Gewichtung beisteuert.

Für mich ist das Spiel eine tolle Erfahrung und ich glaub dass ich in Zukunft noch einen Durchgang einplanen werde, denn ich bin der [b]Erweckte![/b] :-)

185768998.review:
I've played this game a lot at this point and I honestly cant recommend it.

I cant explain how much potential this game has. When this game is functioning as I feel like it was intended to function, its one of the best RPG's ever made, the thing is, it almost never felt like that. The promise of unparalleled RPG gameplay is what had me coming back every single time, but it was just never quite there. 

The story was boring and unsatisfying, and thats pretty wild since if you write it down on paper the story sounds completely unhinged, and like a good time but its not. The stakes were never adequately explained and pretty much no time or quests were dedicated to developing the relationships to ground my character in the world at all. In the first few minutes I'm playing a dude on his way to fight the dragon, I dont know this guy or the context of the fight and before I can really understand whats going on, I'm now a different character who has their heart stolen by a dragon. The consequences of not having a heart dont seem to be too dire since my character wakes up the next day with a scar but no other issues. So after some obligatory quests for the duke, the dragon comes back to ask why youre taking so long, steals my beloved ( I didnt even know there was a romance system in the game) and makes me fight him. A couple of minutes after the fight the city explodes, you fight a different dragon and then fight God who is inexplicably easier to kill than most enemies in the game and then kill yourself........ what?!?!

The game has a lot of really cool combat and AI mechanics but theyre really poorly explained. For example I knew you could grapple small enemies and objects but I didn’t  know I could climb enemies for the first half of my playthrough and thats a pretty significant ability in combat. 

The enemies are really well designed but the variety is pretty weak. Its not that there isnt variety available either, its just that the game doesn’t employ any of the enemies it has. For instance in the overworld, for most of the game the only large monsters or bosses available for you to fight are one drake, and like 15 giants and chimeras. Meanwhile in the first few minutes of the game they had you fight a hydra, but didn’t let you kill it and you never see another hydra until one specific spot in the post dragon world, there’s also a griffin, (who shows up like once for you to fight and the rest of the time he's just flying overhead and nearly impossible to aggro), 3 additional types of wyverns, super giant saurians, skeleton mages, giant hellhounds, additional giant variants, and the freaking beholders from DnD. and for some reason each of these only gets used around one time each in the main game. 

Progression is weird too. You have like 3 avenues of progression, those being character level, gear power, and class level. Character level functions as expected, its a straight forward increase to power, correspondent with the exp gained from combat and quests. Gear power is weird though. The starting gear isnt bad..... its usable even into the late game if you upgrade it. The really weird thing is that theres no real compelling reason to change gear as you progress. Everything seems to be about equal for the majority of the campaign, at least until you kill the dragon the first time which is like 70% of the way through the game. Class level is also weird since its pretty easy to max a class within a few hours of fighting general enemies. After the class is maxed your only additional power increases come from certain accessories which can augment your skills and your character level. All of this together makes the power scaling in this game lurch around very inconsistently. You are extremely weak at the start as both your class and character level are both 1 and you have next to no skills. Then you suddenly spike in power as your class maxes out but thats like one third of the way through the story so for the rest of the time your power is pretty much static, in fact it feels like you get weaker as you get into the late game since the enemies are getting stronger while you stay relatively the same.

Finally, I'd like to discuss the enemy difficulty. I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT IS GOING ON HERE. Enemy difficulty seems to bounce between being damn near impossible to kill and one shot kills. This makes the game feel boring most of the time since killing one shot kill enemies feels pointless and grinding through an HP bar thicker than the earth's crust is just an exercise in frustration. This becomes most prevalent on Bitter black Isle. For example, I fought the second to last boss of bitter black isle (the blue glowing suit of armor) twice, The first time I fought it I beat it in about 5-10 minutes. Not a very hard fight. I left to go get additional healing items for the fight against the final boss but when I came back the boss had respawned. The second time I faced it, I used the same gear, same pawns and the same skills but it just refused to take any damage. I still won since its move set is easily dodgeable but grinding through its HP took me nearly an hour.

In addition to this the game has several bugs which can lead to additional frustration. The most irritating bug I've run into is that certain drakes upon reaching very low health will fly away and bounce in the ocean, out of reach of my bow and my pawn's magic. Whats worse is that its a pretty common bug for the drake north of gran soren.

On paper I should love everything about this game, it has massive amounts of potential and depth but the execution this time around is just too poor for me to recommend.

After having this game in my wishlist for close to a decade, I was gifted this and installed it straight away.  I may have given this a "meh" rating if available, but I feel like I need to try bring balance to the Very Positive reviews here.

I felt so disengaged playing this game and it took me a long while to figure out why.  For me, the silent protagonist is a big problem.  You have no agency AND you are literally silent.  I cannot even inject my own personality onto this hero as he looks upon events with a slight frown or exaggerated shock.  You just sit back and watch yourself being tossed from pillar to post.  This made it very difficult to engage with the main story.  The Pawns are a huge part of this world, yet you don't even get much from the relationship with your own Pawn.  At least throw me some exposition so I can get into the lore of the world.

The side quests are equally disengaging with a lot of fetch and escort quests.  And oh boy, is it a lot of travelling, all on foot with that stamina meter ticking down - take a lot of mushrooms, wherever you go.  Yes, you get "Port Crystals" which you can place strategically, but better fast travel would've been very much welcomed.
There's a quest where you need to find some evidence and there's a quest marker on the opposite side of the map.  I didn't have any Port Crystals that side, so travelled by foot only to find that the quest marker is the EXACT same NPC that's in the main town, offering the same stuff (╯°□°)╯︵ ┻━┻

The combat starts off enjoyable, but as you become more powerful, the combat becomes repetitive, especially as you encounter the same enemies over and over.  Even the once challenging chimera becomes a mere pest to farm for materials.  I'm not sure I want to switch up vocations again, but it may be the best way to make the combat feel fresh again.  You could probably master all vocations in one play through.

I cannot excuse the UI just because it was released in 2012.  The UI is dreadful. There is no keybind for the map, something you frequently need to look at - you have to open up the pause menu, then go to Map.  This is also where you access the Quests and Equipment section, which is different from the inventory for some reason 🙈
Making Curatives or Tools is a pain as you have to select the correct ingredient to combine with others, instead of having a separate Crafting menu where you could select the item you want to create and seeing if you have the appropriate ingredients.

I'm still going to finish the game, maybe just for the noddy badge.

Es una joya que brilla por si mismo, una obra maestra del género RPG de acción que combina un combate dinámico, un mundo vibrante y un sistema de compañeros único que eleva la experiencia a otro nivel. Si estás buscando un juego que te sumerja en aventuras épicas, este título es una parada obligatoria.

Qué lo que hace especial?? Además de su gran historia reflejada en Netflix..

COMBATE: Desde enfrentamientos con goblins hasta batallas épicas contra quimeras y dragones, es simplemente espectacular. La posibilidad de trepar a gigantescos enemigos para atacar puntos débiles añade una capa de estrategia y adrenalina. Cada clase, ya sea Guerrero, Arquero, Mago, Asesino o sus derivadas, se sienten únicas y satisfactorias.

SISTEMA DE PEONES: Los peones, tus compañeros controlados por la IA, son más que simples aliados. Pueden aprender tácticas de combate, adaptarse a tu estilo de juego e incluso ser compartidos con otros jugadores online. Este sistema crea una conexión entre la comunidad de jugadores y aporta frescura constante a tu equipo.

ES UN MUNDO LLENO DE MISTERIOS: Es un mundo vasto, hermoso y peligroso. Desde cuevas oscuras hasta castillos abandonados, cada rincón del mapa está lleno de secretos esperando a ser descubiertos. Las misiones son variadas, y la narrativa, aunque sutil, tiene giros intrigantes que recompensan a los jugadores atentos.

DARK ARISEN: La expansión añade Bitterblack Isle, una zona desafiante, oscura y llena de enemigos temibles con un botín exclusivo. Es el reto perfecto para jugadores veteranos en busca de emoción extra.

ASPECTOS A CONSIDERAR: El juego no es perfecto. Los gráficos muestran su edad en algunos aspectos. Aún así son encantadores en diseño y tiene buen sonido. Al comienzo, pareciera que el sistema de viaje rápido puede ser limitado, hasta que vas desbloqueando ciertos objetos. Sin embargo, estos detalles no opacan la experiencia general.

RECOMENDACIONES: Antes de arrancar guarden mis guías en favoritos, son de gran utilidad y tendrán los mapas del mundo para avanzar mucho más rápido (Gransys, Bitterblack Isle y Everfall de end game). CONCLUSION: Es un RPG imprescindible para los amantes de los desafíos, la exploración y los combates épicos. Aunque pueda tener algunos bordes ásperos, su corazón late con una intensidad que pocos juegos logran igualar. Cada batalla, cada descubrimiento y cada decisión en este mundo deja huella.
